KnowledgeBase.Title: var
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: range kurtosis skew stdev stdevp varp
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: standard deviation variance distribution sample curve displacement mean

Function.Description: The var function computes the variance of a population based on a sample of values specified in the argument list.

Brief.Overview: The var function computes the variance of a population based on a sample of values specified in the argument list. Variance measures the spread or variation of values from the mean. The standard deviation of a population sample is the square root of the variance of that sample.
Brief.Usage: The var function is useful for determining if, and determining how much, a sample of values is different from the mean of the values.

Syntax.Return: The variance of a population based on a sample of values specified in the argument list.
